documents.document: T: together E: everyone A: achieves M: more
Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman. ~Conrad Hilton
A positive attitude gives you power over your circumstances instead of your circumstances having power over you.
I have spent my days stringing and unstringing my instrument while the song I came to sing remains unsung. ~Rabindranath Tagore
When someone is trying to change their ways, the worst thing you can do is keep bringing up the past. ~Unknown
A man’s growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
Stop with the labels… because we are not jam jars; we are extraordinary, different, wonderful people. ~Caroline Casey
If you’re miserable, make a choice. If you’re still miserable, you can choose again. ~Martha Beck
The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one. ~Elbert Hubbard
The old believe everything; the middle-aged suspect everything; the young know everything. ~Oscar Wilde
Everyone is trying to accomplish something big, not realizing that life is made up of little things. ~Frank A Clark
Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can’t lose. ~Bill Gates
Those who are too smart to engage in politics are punished by being governed by those who are dumber. ~Plato
I don’t design clothes, I design dreams. ~Ralph Lauren
There is no value in life except what you choose to place upon it and no happiness in any place except what you bring to it yourself. ~Henry David Thoreau
Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough. ~Mark Zuckerburg
I try to do the right thing at the right time. They may just be little things, but usually they make the difference between winning and losing. ~Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
If you have enough push, you don’t have to worry about the pull. ~Zig Ziglar
Life is not about how fast you run or how high you climb but how well you bounce. ~Vivian Komori
I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence but it comes from within. It was there all the time. ~Anna Freud
The great majority of men are bundles of beginnings. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
Just because something ended doesn’t mean it never should have been. Remember, you lived, you learned, you grew and you moved on.
A winner is a loser who was willing to fail and get up, fail and get up, fail and get up, fail and get up, and then win. ~Pete Zafra
Trust is like an eraser, it gets smaller and smaller after every mistake.
Make progress one time and it makes you happy. Make progress day after day, week after week and it makes you a champion. ~Greg Werner
Anything in life that we don’t accept will simply make trouble for us until we make peace with it. ~Shakti Gawain
It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you’ll do things differently. ~Warren Buffett
Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely. ~Auguste Rodin
Giving it everything you have is the only way you will get everything you want.
Sometimes, we need to be hurt in order to grow. We must lose in order to gain. Sometimes, some lessons are learned best through pain.
What you believe about yourself impacts you more than what others believe about you. ~Bill Bartmann
Success is not about the background you’re from, it’s about the confidence you have and the effort you’re willing to invest. ~Michelle Obama
Success is more permanent when you achieve it without destroying your principles. ~Walter Cronkite
Always end the day with a positive thought. No matter how hard things were, tomorrow’s a fresh opportunity to make it better.
Hatred does not cease through hatred at any time. Hatred ceases through love. This is an unalterable law. ~Buddha
Take chances, make mistakes. That’s how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. ~Mary Tyler Moore
Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway. ~Earl Nightingale
Being defeated is often a temporary condition; giving up is what makes it permanent.
You can suffer the pain of change, or suffer remaining the way you are.
Becoming conscious is of course a sacrilege against nature; it is as though you had robbed the unconscious of something. ~Carl Jung
It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity. ~Albert Einstein
Don’t give up on the people you love. Your patient love and faithfulness may be exactly what they need to make a complete turnaround.
There are rich people, and there are those who have money. They are not the same people. ~Coco Chanel
The distinction between the past, present and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion. ~Albert Einstein
If you want to make a permanent change, stop focusing on the size of your problems and start focusing on the size of you! ~T. Harv Eker
No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes. ~Hugh Downs
Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful. ~William Morris
We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we’re curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths. ~Walt Disney
I also became close to nature, and am now able to appreciate the beauty with which this world is endowed. ~James Dean
The mind has a thousand eyes, and the heart but one; Yet the light of a whole life dies, when love is done. ~Francis William Bourdillon
If you fail a test in life, you’ll face it time and time again until you pass it. The stakes keep getting higher if you don’t learn how to pass. ~Dawn Staley
A good coach will make his players see what they can be rather than what they are. ~Ara Parseghian
No eternal reward will forgive us now for wasting the dawn. ~Jim Morrisson
We know what a person things not when they tell us what they are thinking, but by their actions. ~Isaac Bashevis Singer
The most important thing about goals is having one. ~Geoffrey Albert
If you want something you’ve never had then you’ve got to do something you’ve never done.
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Wishing is not enough; we must do. ~Johann Von Goethe
In the right light, at the right time, everything is extraordinary. ~Aaron Rose
A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort. ~Herm Albright
Once the game is over, the king and the pawn go back in the same box. ~Italian Proverb
Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow. ~Robert Kiyosaki
Let not thy will roar when thy power can be a whisper. ~Thomas Fuller
The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else. ~Umberto Eco
The truly great man is he who would master no one, and who would be mastered by none. ~Kahlil Gibran
We became uncompetitive by not being tolerant of mistakes. ~Roberto Goizueta
There is something that is much more scarce, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognise ability. ~Robert Half
Don’t waste time grieving over past mistakes. Learn from them and move on.
At the end of every hard day, people find some reason to believe. ~Bruce Springsteen
Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time. ~Jim Rohn
Instead of looking at the hundred reasons to quit, look at the thousand reasons not to give up.
There is something that is much more scarce, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognise ability. ~Robert Half
MIf we are to go forward, we must go back and rediscover those precious values. ~Martin Luther King
The pessimist complains about the wind. The optimist expects it to change. The leader adjusts the sails. ~John Maxwell
It’s the most unhappy people who most fear change. ~Mignon McLaughlin
Players think: Play me and I’ll show you. Coaches think: Show me and I’ll play you. ~Shaka Smart
Humility is not thinking less of yourself, but thinking of yourself less.
A new leader has to be able to change an organisation that is dreamless, soulless and vision-less. ~Warren Bennis
Don't confuse your path with your destination, just because it's stormy now, doesn't mean you aren't headed for sunshine.
You can never understand one language until you understand at least two. ~Geoffrey Willans
Give me the liberty to know, to utter, and to argue freely according to conscience, above all liberties. ~John Milton
All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure. ~Mark Twain
The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me. ~Ayn Rand
God didn’t make a mistake when He made you. You need to see yourself as God sees you. ~Joel Osteen
All is well. Everything I need comes to me at the perfect moment. ~Louise L. Hay
One cannot and must not try to erase the past merely because it does not fit the present. ~Golda Meir
Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other. ~Walter Elliot
Some of life’s best lessons are learned at the worst times. ~Ani Difranco
You don’t know what the future holds, but you know who holds it. Trust God!
You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. ~Henry Ford
Don’t think of words when you stop but to see the picture better. ~Jack Kerouac
It is important from time to time to slow down, to go away by yourself, and simply be. ~Eileen Caddy
Many a man thinks he is buying pleasure, when he is really selling himself to it. ~Benjamin Franklin
Enjoy the moments you’re living in, they don’t last forever.
You don’t realize how inappropriate some lyrics are until there is a young kid in your car repeating them.
The most formidable weapon against errors of every kind is reason. ~Thomas Paine
Justice is the set and constant purpose which gives every man his due. ~Marcus Tullius Cicero
Without God, you can do nothing. With God, there is nothing you can’t do.
We need to stop listening to the loudest voice in the room and start listening to the smartest voice in the room. ~Paul Ryan
A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others. ~Ayn Rand
